text.p: Naphtha prices recovered on Tuesday with the contango narrowing on shortcovering, traders said.
"The contango is narrowing just because of some parties covering their short positions," a trader with a major oil company said.
"But I would not call it bullishness .. more a recovery or an adjustment," he said.
In Japan, the spread between September 1-15 and October 1-15 open-spec narrowed to -50/+50 cents per tonne.
The contango between August and September Singapore naphtha swaps had also diasppeared and were talked at par at $20.60/$20.80 per barrel. July was still in contango at $20.55/$20.75.
"I don't know whether you would call it bullish news but the East/West spread is also narrower," a trader said.
He said the spread was currently around $22 per tonne compared to $30-$35 in the second quarter.
"But I can't find any reason for the market to go into a big backwardation," he said.
High stocks in North Asia dampened demand with only around three requirements heard for South Korea in the second-half August.
"They can receive the naphtha but they don't definitely need it," a supplier said.
The only firm demand in the region was heard from Thailand for an aromatics plant.
The market rumoured a deal had been done at $2 below Japanese spot quotes on a c+f basis, but the parties had yet to conclude the deal for the July delivery cargo, sources said.
Gasoline was similarly lacklustre ahead of tomorrow's close of Taiwan import reformate tender and Saudi Aramco's export reformate tender.
One trader said there was some interest in the Saudi cargo from traders with storage in the Mideast.
Unleaded 95-octane lifting August 3-7 was bid at $23.00 per barrel fob Singapore, but only faced a 92-octane unleaded seller at $22.50 for a cargo lifting July 26-30.
(Prices are in dollars per barrel)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
JUL NAPHTHA SWAPS 20.55/20.75 20.50/20.65
AUG NAPHTHA SWAPS 20.60/20.80 20.55/20.70

-- Singapore Newsroom (+65-870-3086)
